intro: Leptochilus cuspidatus var. crenatus, commonly known as the serrated spurwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with distinctive spurred petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have serrated edges, giving it its common name. It is a low-growing plant that produces violet-blue flowers in late spring to early summer.
